responses.stem: The manager ____ the report by Friday.
responses.explanation: 三単現のs。主語the managerに合わせexpects。expectingやto expectは形が合わない。

responses.stem: Our team will meet ____ the morning to finalize the plan.
responses.explanation: 時の部分はin the morningが自然。on/at/byは用法が異なる。

responses.stem: The new policy is intended to ____ productivity across departments.
responses.explanation: 目的は生産性を上げる→raise。ariseは自動詞、raise upは不自然。

responses.stem: Employees are encouraged to submit suggestions ____ improving workflow.
responses.explanation: suggestions for ~ing の定型。to/about/with はこのコロケーションでは不適。

responses.stem: Ms. Chen was ____ to lead the project due to her experience.
responses.explanation: was selected と受動。lead を導くのは人→過去分詞が妥当。

responses.stem: The device comes with a one-year ____ covering parts and labor.
responses.explanation: 保証はwarranty。warningは警告、guaranteeも可だが製品仕様ではwarrantyが一般的。

responses.stem: Because the site was under maintenance, customers ____ longer than usual.
responses.explanation: 過去の事実→waited。were wait / have wait は文法誤り。

responses.stem: Please review the attached draft and provide any ____ by Thursday.
responses.explanation: feedback/informationは不可算。複数形不可。

responses.stem: The CEO emphasized that the new product must be both affordable ____ reliable.
responses.explanation: both A and B のand。並列接続。

responses.stem: All orders placed before noon ____ the same day.
responses.explanation: 一般的な受動の現在→are shipped。ship単体は三単現のsがなく不一致。

responses.stem: The marketing team is looking for a ____ designer with experience in B2C campaigns.
responses.explanation: a の後は形容詞 creative + 名詞 designer。語形に注意。

responses.stem: Due to unexpected demand, the supply of spare parts has been ____.
responses.explanation: has been + 過去分詞。状態の受動。limited が自然。

responses.stem: Notice: The office cafeteria will be closed on Tuesday for equipment maintenance. Employees should bring their own lunch or visit nearby restaurants.
options: The cafeteria is closed every Tuesday.
Employees cannot eat lunch on Tuesday.
The cafeteria will not operate on a specific day.
Only breakfast will be served on Tuesday.
responses.explanation: 特定の火曜に休業という告知→運営しない日がある、が要旨。

responses.stem: Email: Hi team, the client meeting has been moved from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. to accommodate travel delays. Please adjust your schedules accordingly.
options: The meeting will be held earlier.
The meeting time has been postponed.
The location of the meeting changed.
responses.explanation: moved from 10 to 2 →延期（後ろへ移動）。

responses.stem: Article: Green Metro plans to add two new train lines by 2027, aiming to reduce commute times by up to 20 percent for suburban riders.
options: Green Metro will reduce fares by 20 percent.
The expansion is intended to shorten travel times.
Two lines will open next year.
The plan targets downtown commuters only.
responses.explanation: 目的は通勤時間短縮。数字（20%）は効果の程度。

responses.stem: Message: Reminder—Please submit your monthly expense reports by the 5th of each month to ensure timely reimbursement.
options: Reports are due at the end of the month.
Submitting reports on time helps payment processing.
responses.explanation: 期限遵守で払い戻しが円滑、という趣旨→目的の選択。

responses.stem: Flyer: Weekend Market—Local farmers will sell fresh produce from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. at Riverside Park. Bring your own bags.
options: The market sells only packaged goods.
The event takes place in the evening.
Visitors are encouraged to carry bags.
Only farmers can enter the park.
responses.explanation: Bring your own bags の言い換え→持参を促す。

responses.stem: Internal Note: The software update improves performance, but some users may need to clear their cache to see changes.
options: The update slows down the software.
Users will automatically see changes without action.
Clearing cache might be necessary after the update.
The update is not about performance.
responses.explanation: 性能改善。ただし変更反映にキャッシュクリアが必要な場合あり、の条件文。

responses.stem: Review: The hotel is conveniently located near the station, but the rooms are small. Staff were friendly and helpful.
options: The location is far from transportation.
The hotel has pros and cons.
responses.explanation: 立地は良いが部屋が狭い→利点と欠点の両方の記述。

responses.stem: Memo: To reduce paper waste, the company will adopt digital signatures for internal approvals starting next month.
options: The company will print more documents.
Paper use is expected to decrease.
Digital signatures will be optional this year.
responses.explanation: 紙の削減が目的→デジタル署名採用で紙使用が減る、が妥当。
